reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at La Bourdonnais for 3 nights in September. The room was very clean and the bathroom was recently renovated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. If you have travellers cheques they will exchange for cash if they have some cash availble. The breakfest was average but there is a grocery store next door to pick up snacks, wine, etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The locations was incredible. It was walking distance to the Eiffel tower, Rue Cler, Napolian's tomb and the subway. My wife really enjoyed picking up some wine in the store, grabbing some bread, cheese, pastries from Rue Cler and eating under the Eiffel tower.
reviews.title: Great value - great location

likes.disliked: — Lack of fresh fruit at breakfast and foul tasting coffee

reviews.text: On the negative side our room faced the road and there was some noise in the morning due to the garbage pickup which seemed to be daily.
reviews.title: Not that bad!

likes.disliked: — Bit dated, or very traditionally parisian, depending on your view

reviews.title: Acceptable but nothing special
reviews.text: Overall a really good value hotel.

reviews.title: Very small rooms
reviews.text: I had a very nice experience staying here. The place is very centalized, which means it is not far from the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood was great esp if you are just getting off the Metro after midnight. You are not scared to walk to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location, only 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and 5 minutes to the metro station. It is in a lovely area and it feels very safe walking around at night. Our twin room was nicely decorated with new looking curtains, carpet and bed linen, the bathroom was also recently refurbished. Breakfast was pricey at 12 euros each but there are plenty of cafes serving breakfast in the vicinity. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Myself, the wife and our 2 kids just got back from 4 nights at this hotel. We booked a quad-room via hotels.com, and were delighted with what we received. We were on the 5th floor in a spacious room (Room 501) with 2 x double beds and a large bathroom. The room had a balcony (albeit very narrow) with views of the Eiffel tower (see photo). It also had a flat-screen LCD TV and a/c. There was no mini-bar or fridge, but a quick call to reception and within 10 minutes we had a small fridge delivered to the room - perfect for keeping the beers and wine cool :-). Note that the hotel does not have a bar.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great location

reviews.text: Overall the cleanliness of the room was second-to-none, matched by the wonderful location of this hotel (2 mins walk to Ecole Militaire metro, 10 mins walk to Eiffel Tower).
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, Reasonable price

likes.disliked: — line and carpets seemed well worn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and would certainly stay here again if we returned to Paris.
reviews.title: great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days. My criterea when I was looking for a place included: room to accomidate 4 people, reasonable price, ac, non smoking , decent area. Hotel Bourdonnais met and exceeded my expectations. We had a standard room that had 2 queen beds. We paided 169 US dollars a night plus tax. Booked through our travel agent. The rate did not include breakfast. which was 12 Euros per person extra. Since 48 Euros for a family of 4 to have a continental breakfast seemed unreasonable, we did not try the breakfast. The breakfast/solarium room did look very pretty. Instead we walked next door to the grocery store and bought milk, yougart, and fruit everyday. for about 10 euros total. The bathroom in room 201 was large and modern. The carpetting and bedding looked worn but clean. The beds were comfortable and we slept well. We asked for a non smoking room. 201 did have an ashtray on the table but nothing in the room smelled like smoke, so I didn't see the need to complain. Front desk staff very friendly and spoke english well( except for 1 female clerk who was consistantly rude in multiple languages). We had an early arrival flight and checked in at 11am, no problem. The area around the hotel was lovely and we felt very safe walking late at night. It is a very short walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, and Rue Cler. We would defineltly stay at this place again
reviews.title: Impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel...management very friendly...hotel very close to metro and small grocery...would definitely stay again
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in late April 07 with our 2 year old son. Room was large for Paris and bathroon was relatively new. Overall the experience was positive. Obviously this is only a 3 star, so it needs to be taken with a grain of salt.
reviews.title: Solid 3 Star Paris Hotel

reviews.text: That said, good location, good service. We parked our car in lot very near to the hotel (24 euro/day). We also took advantage of baby sitting provided by hotel on two nights (10 euro/hr). Overall all went well.
reviews.title: Great location, choose your room carefully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a family of two adults and two children aged 8 and 6 and stayed here at the height of the heatwave in Europe in July 2006. We had looked especially for an airconditioned room so we had a cool haven to return to after sight seeing. The location of the hotel was fantastic - we could easily walk to the Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire station was just around the corner and there were two supermarkets very close. I would agree with other reviews that the staff were not overly friendly, but our room away from the street on the first floor was large, clean and cool unlike my sister's family's room which overlooked the street, smelt of cigarettes and had no air conditioning! Make sure you ask for a non smoking room - it makes a big difference if they have one available. We would definitely stay here again in the future
reviews.title: fab location and large room for Paris!

likes.liked: — the size of the rooms and it's location was v. central
likes.disliked: — staff could have been a little more friendly

reviews.text: The room was much bigger than we were used to in Paris - especially as it was fairly cheap and booked last minute! The bathroom was huge. Fab location - v. near a metro and the eiffel tower. Staff not overly friendly, but as we know our way around Paris this was fine - if you were first time visitors who maybe wanted info you might be a little hard pushed. Breakfast seemed a little expensive so we didn't bother - especially as the cafe on Rue Jean Millet which has its own chocolate factory is just around the corner!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel less than 1 minute from the Metro - a Gem!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel last year for my dad's 60th Birthday along with 7 other members of my family including two children. We booked after reading fantastic review on tripadvisor and were not disappointed. Although the hotel was in the middle of refurbishment, our room (for 2 adults and 2 children) was very clean, nicely furnished and with a view of the Eiffel Tower as were the other two rooms. The bathroom had just been renovated and was excellent. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, letting my son practice his French. Location was terrific as we could walk to the Eiffel Tower. Local restaurants were great, especially La Terrasse which was virtually on our doorstep and sold terrific food and managed to accommodate 8 people at short notice. Would definitely stay there again with the family. My dad who is extremely fussy and difficult to please loved his stay at this hotel so I can't give it a better recommendation than that!
reviews.title: Fantastic Value and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here for our 13th anniversary back in 2003. A quaint hotel, nice rooms, very traditional style. Excellent position for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Definately want to return
Overpriced fire trap, in the states we call them "Rat holes"
reviews.text: We dined at the hotel next door (was actually part of the hotel, not sure if still is) and had a truly magnificent meal, exceptional service and great wine. Couldn't believe when we got the bill and it was only HALF of what we expected to pay!

I booked the hotel based on the reviews written on the website. That was a mistake. For the price, I was expecting it to be a legitamate hotel with water and decent space but those reviews lied. There was no water for several hours after we check'd in. They didn't bother telling us the water was off. The bath was newly remodeled and large but no good without water! The room was so tiny we stacked our suit cases to get around the bed. We'd stayed several days in Paris at a cheaper hotel with a lot more space, and all the water we could use! Seems a rebate for the price of the room would have been in order for not having water. The creaking in the hall from the old hotel was so bad we were afraid we might step through the floor. What kind of fire hazard is it with no water available? I think they need to bulldoze this place and put in something legitamate. We traveled through 4 countries in Europe and this was the only place we felt like we didn't get our money's worth. Too bad to end our Euro trip on such a sour note.
reviews.title: The top end of a 3 star Parisien hotel with charm

likes.disliked: — No tea/coffee facilities (but really was not an issue)

reviews.title: We'll be back - Hotel De La Bourdonnais
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. I was lucky enough to spend 2 days in Paris on business and found the hotel through expedia.com.au.
